column1: '''Bregalad's Song'''<ref group="note">"Bregalad's Song" is named in the Index to ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]''.</ref> is a lament that [[Bregalad]] the [[Ents|Ent]] sings for [[Meriadoc Brandybuck|Merry]] and [[Peregrin Took|Pippin]] on [[30 February]] {{TA|3019}}<ref>{{App|Great}}</ref> while he keeps them company as the other Ents continue to hold their [[Entmoot]].  The first line names three trees that Bregalad was especially fond of that are now gone
column2: cut down by [[Orcs]] from [[Isengard]].  Bregalad softly sings in many tongues and the two hobbits fall asleep to the sound of his voice.<ref>{{TT|III4}}</ref>
